# skangagani

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of skangagani is to offer two functions; one binds two factors and another one raises a number to a power of nine.

## Installation

You can install the released version of skangagani from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("skangagani")
```

And the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("GusMalija/skangagani")
```
## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(skangagani)
# moto(domi$Sato[c(4, 62, 150)], Manu$Nyama[c(7, 18, 39)])
```
